action.action-desc: Mr. Budd introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committees on Oversight and Government Reform, and Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To provide for a study and reconsideration by Congress of certain major rules, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reset Act of 2017.

section.header: Government accountability office study of rules

subsection.text: The Comptroller General of the United States shall conduct a study to determine, as of the date of the enactment of this Actâ€”

paragraph.text: how many rules (as such term is defined in section 804 of title 5, United States Code) were in effect;
how many major rules (as such term is defined in section 804 of title 5, United States Code) were in effect; and
the total estimated economic cost imposed by all such rules.

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit a report to Congress that contains the findings of the study conducted under subsection (a).

section.text: In the case of any major rule (as such term is defined in section 804 of title 5, United States Code) that is in effect on the date of enactment of this Act, for purposes of chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, the rule shall be deemed to be a major rule for which a report was submitted under section 801(a)(1) of such title on the date the report under section 2 is submitted, and the provisions of such chapter shall apply for purposes of providing for a period of review in which a joint resolution of disapproval may be enacted.
